definition: dross/dregs/rubbish/fig. useless residue
dregs/draff/pickled in wine/rotten/messy/ruined
grains in distilled liquor
to remove the dross/to discard the dregs

take the cream, discard the dross (political and educational slogan)/keep what is good, discard the rest/You need to be selective when studying./In modernizing the country, don't accept uncritically all foreign ideas.
pinyin: qu3 qi2 jing1 hua2 , qu4 qi2 zao1 po4

sentences.english: Therefore, Keep its essence and discard its dross in the course of the study.
sentences.chinese: 對《顏氏家訓》研究要取其精華，去其糟粕。

sentences.english: The film is to be cleaned up and re- edited.
sentences.chinese: 這部影片應剔除糟粕，重新進行剪輯。

sentences.english: He thinks most modern artis trash.
sentences.chinese: 他認爲現代藝術大都是糟粕。

sentences.english: Come , Dowsed in mud , Soaked in bleach.
sentences.chinese: 來，到糟粕裏尋寶，在漂白劑裏浸禮。

sentences.english: Some interview content very expatiatory , how to take its flower, go its scum?
sentences.chinese: 有些採訪內容十分冗長，如何取其精華，去其糟粕呢？

sentences.english: He thinks most modern art is trash.
sentences.chinese: 他認爲現代藝術大都是糟粕。

sentences.english: What we should make sure is to absorb the essence and discard the dregs.
sentences.chinese: 我們要做到的是取其精華，棄其糟粕。

sentences.english: For those works, we might discard the dross and select the essence as well.
sentences.chinese: 對於這樣的作品，我們不妨取其精華，去其糟粕。

sentences.english: B: Without doubt, rock is trash.
sentences.chinese: 毫無疑問，搖滾樂是糟粕。
他認爲現代藝術大都是糟粕。

definition: to take the best/to absorb the essence
to remove the dross/to discard the dregs
trite/clichéd/empty and trite/banality/platitude
the teaching of Confucius and Mencius
feudal way of thinking
system of enfeoffment/feudalism/feudal/feudalistic
to recount history but omit one's ancestors (idiom); to forget one's roots
to regard men as superior to women (idiom)
Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
conservative and unable to adapt (idiom)

three principles and five virtues (idiom)/the three rules (ruler guides subject, father guides son and husband guides wife) and five constant virtues of Confucianism (benevolence 仁, righteousness 義|义, propriety 禮|礼, wisdom 智 and fidelity 信)
Confucian thoughts/the thinking of the Confucian school
thought/thinking/idea/ideology/CL:個|个[ge4]
to swallow ancient learning without digesting it (idiom)/to be pedantic without having a mastery of one's subject
to cherish the outmoded and preserve the outworn (idiom); conservative/stickler for tradition
cultural tradition
